results.title: A Merry Chase: Prelude a L'apres midi d'un faune by Claude Debussy
results.brief_description: Excerpt from Bruno Bozzetto’s “Allegro Non Troppo”. A squat and aging satyr lusts for the sexual attention of young nymphs of the serene woodland. Music from Debussy.

results.title: A Measure of security
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Robert Guenette
results.brief_description: Documents the range and effectiveness of the U.S. Social Security system. It is the story of four people deriving supplemental incomes through old-age, disability, medicare and survivor benefits under the Social Security programme. All lead full and productive lives that might otherwise have been blighted by fear and poverty.

results.title: A meal at Francis' = Un repas chez Francis
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and John Seabourne
results.brief_description: An American girl and her French friend have lunch together in Paris. They look for a restaurant and then the American girl is shown how to order a meal, name foods and beverages, the French girl also explains French eating habits all carried out in simple slowly-spoken French.

results.title: A Matthew Flinders Story
results.brief_description:
A reenactment of the journey of Flinders, Bass and Martin to Botany Bay and Sydney Heads. They meet Aboriginals during their journey.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: A Matter of time
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Martin Lahse and Arthur Allan Seidelman
results.brief_description: Based on a novel by Roni Schotter, this film chronicles a 16-year-old girl’s painful period of growth as she confronts her mother’s inevitable death from a malignant tumor. In the process, she emerges from behind her mother’s shadow and discovers her own special talent. Cast includes Karlene Crocket, Rob Lowe, Rosemary Forsythe, Carrie Freeman, Kate Bentall, Malcolm Groome.

results.title: A Matter of survival
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Canada Department of Labour, Bill Brind and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: Much has been said about the predicament of the blue-collar worker in the automated world of industry. This film is about a similar threat to the white-collar worker in the business world. It portrays a situation in a company where computer methods are about to be introduced to take over much of the paperwork, consequently “making surplus” a number of responsible, long-time employees. The film poses the problem from the points of view of both management and of the employees concerned. Awards: New York; Antwerp; Knokke

results.title: A Matter of survival
results.creator_credit: Tasfilm Productions, National Fitness Council of Tasmania, Don Anderson and Rodney Musch
results.brief_description: Set in the rugged Cradle Mountain region of Tasmania, this film points out the dangers of exposure for those who go into the mountains unprepared. An experienced group of walkers demonstrate, equipment, clothing, food, and techniques suitable for bushwalking.

results.title: A Matter of manners
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Colin Dean
results.brief_description: Made to improve the relations of the Commonwealth Public Service with the public, this film focuses attention on three important factors in giving service: the need for suitable office facilities in the form of counters, reception desks and entrances to government offices; The desirability of selecting counter staff and receptionists who have an aptitude for their work, expressed in the right approach to the public over the counter; the importance of systematic training for counter staff and receptionists in the fundamental and details of their jobs. Camera - Frank Bagnall. PLEASE NOTE: THIS FILM IS AVAILABLE FOR SCREENINGS TO COMMONWEALTH AND STATE GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENTS ONLY. THE PERMISSION OF THE COMMONWEALTH PUBLIC SERVICE BOARD IS NECESSARY FOR ALL OTHER SCREENINGS OF THIS TITLE.

results.title: A Matter of life and death
results.creator_credit: Archers Film Productions, Independent Producers, Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburger
results.brief_description: Squadron Leader Peter Carter (David Niven), is caught between two worlds, reality, and the other which exists in his imagination that has been contaminated by war. As his plane travels over the English Channel in a ball of fire, he prepares to jump without a parachute. In what he believes are his final moments he shares his feelings on love and poetry with an American WAC, Kim Hunter. After he lands ashore he meets the WAC and they fall in love. All seems well, but a case of concussion causes Carter to experience hallucinations in which he finds himself on trial within his imaginary world. This film also features Raymond Massey, Roger Livesey and Richard Attenbourough. Also known as “Stairway to heaven”. Earthbound sequences are filmed in technicolour and Heaven sequences in black and white.

results.title: A Matter of fat
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and William Weintraub
results.brief_description: A rather astonishing film showing how one man shed nearly half his body weight - 63 kg of it (140 pounds) - by complete starvation under hospital observation. What brought him to so desperate a course, and how he managed to cope with it, is told with candor and humor by the fat man himself. Lorne Greene narrates the rest. Between times, the film leaves Gilles Lorrain and his lonely struggle to examine what other overweight people are doing, singly or in groups, to reduce to more normal proportions. Medical authorities comment on some misconceptions and malpractices of the slimming industry. Narrated by Lorne Green. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Atlanta)
